decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to create a fast and aggressive strategy using efficient spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent while maintaining card advantage. This deck aims to control the game early with disruption spells like Force of Will and Stifle, while also applying pressure with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and True-Name Nemesis. The inclusion of cards like Murktide Regent and Phyrexian Dreadnought add additional threats to the board. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's aggressive game plan while providing utility with cards like Karakas and Urza's Saga.

The deck is focused on utilizing the card "Show and Tell" to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Omniscience onto the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Daze for control and protection. Additionally, cards like Peek and Intuition help find necessary pieces for the combo. The inclusion of Burning Wish allows for access to additional cards from the sideboard, increasing flexibility and adaptability in the heat of battle. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and game-changing spells.

The focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo by using cards like Crop Rotation and Sylvan Reclaimer to search for the necessary lands. Vampire Hexmage can then be used to remove the ice counters from Dark Depths, creating a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes disruption through cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, as well as protection with Sylvan Safekeeper. The goal is to win the game quickly and efficiently by utilizing this powerful combo while controlling the opponent's resources.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on efficiently using cheap, aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, alongside powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck also features graveyard synergies with cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent to generate card advantage and close out games quickly. With a high density of counterspells and removal, this deck aims to disrupt opponents while applying pressure on the board to secure victories.

This Aggro-Affinity deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and utilizing the synergy between them to overwhelm the opponent. Using cards like Mox Opal, Arcbound Ravager, and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to create a fast and powerful board presence that can deal damage efficiently. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thought Monitor provide card advantage, while cards like Walking Ballista and Stonecoil Serpent offer versatile removal options. The use of artifacts like Nettlecyst and Retrofitter Foundry further enhances the deck's ability to generate threats and maintain pressure on opponents.

This Bant Control deck focuses on maintaining board control and card advantage through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, along with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. The deck also utilizes card draw and manipulation with cards like Sylvan Library and Brainstorm, while also having a strong late-game threat in Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage, this deck aims to outvalue opponents and control the game until it can secure a win.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Hedron Crab, then use cards like Altar of Dementia and Bridge from Below to create a loop with Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Gravecrawler to put immense pressure on the opponent. Cards like Vengevine and Bloodghast can also be quickly brought back from the graveyard to further overwhelm the opponent. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, utilizing the graveyard as a resource to win the game quickly.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Ragavan, and Dragon's Rage Channeler to pressure the opponent. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Daze and Force of Will, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt. The mana base is optimized for consistency with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands. The deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize, utilizing efficient creatures and spells to maintain tempo and pressure.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements alongside efficient card draw and removal spells to outvalue opponents and maintain board control. It aims to control the game through counter magic, removal spells, and card advantage to create opportunities to win in the late game. The inclusion of key planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional control and value engines. Additionally, the deck includes efficient creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to apply pressure and provide additional card advantage.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Buried Alive and Thoughtseize, enabling the rapid recursion of Arclight Phoenix. The combination of fast mana acceleration with Dark Ritual, efficient card draw with Brainstorm and Ponder, and disruption with Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, allows this aggro deck to overwhelm opponents with early threats and efficient removal. The presence of counter spells like Force of Will and Daze further solidify the deck's ability to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent while closing out games with powerful threats like Delver of Secrets and Arclight Phoenix.

The main concept of this deck is to use cheap, evasive creatures like Changeling Outcast and Ornithopter to quickly attack the opponent and trigger abilities that take advantage of Ninjas like Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow and Ingenious Infiltrator. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats and control the game. The deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and powerful abilities, while also being able to disrupt the opponent's game plan with countermagic and removal spells.

The deck focuses on putting powerful creatures into play for free by using the Show and Tell combo, utilizing cards such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, Griselbrand, and Omniscience to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It also includes control elements like Force of Will and Veil of Summer to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck's consistency is enhanced with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to dig for key pieces and interaction. The key strategy is to cheat out big threats early and close out the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

The deck focuses on quickly and aggressively controlling the board with a mix of counter spells and removal while utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. It also takes advantage of land recursion with Life from the Loam and Elvish Reclaimer to maintain consistency and generate value. Additionally, Urza's Saga is used to tutor for key artifacts like Retrofitter Foundry to further enhance the deck's aggressive game plan. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure on multiple fronts to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to utilize the combo of Sneak Attack and Show and Tell to quickly bring out powerful creatures such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield. By using cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce to protect the combo, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, game-ending plays. In addition, the deck includes cards like Lotus Petal and Omniscience to further enhance its ability to cheat out big threats early in the game.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive plays using low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by powerful counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect them. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt to control the board while utilizing card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Expressive Iteration. The mana base is streamlined for consistency and the deck aims to finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to apply early pressure and tempo advantage with cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt, while also generating card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Expressive Iteration. The mana base is optimized to support the aggressive game plan with fetch lands and dual lands, while also providing disruption with Wasteland.
